alert.note: Alert for Ketchikan Gateway Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 4:20PM AKST until February 06 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, the Ward Lake Recreation area in the southern inner channels. * WHEN...Until 415 PM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 408 PM AKST, The Lake Connell dam operator near Ward cove has reported that the water level in the lake is near the top of the spillway and rain is ongoing. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in the surrounding area over the past 24 hours and minor flooding from overflow of poor drainage areas is expected, especially near Ward Lake. - Areas near the Ward Lake recreational area is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Lake Connell Dam: At 1:00pm the stage was 251.11 feet. Flood Stage is 252.0 feet.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
